 Question: """Will this work for two cats, or should I get another litter box?  I know two cats require two or more litter boxes, but that's old boxes!"""
JSON List: """[{'comments': ['This cat litter box is great, I have had it for 2 and 1/2 months now.', 'We have 4 cats and one very large (tall and long) cat so finding a litter box to suit them all has been a challenge.', 'I even tried a different "traditional" litter box about six months ago that used pellets, and the cat would pee, it would go down through the pellets to a pad in a drawer.  ', 'The recommendation is 1 litter box per kitty then 1 more.  ', 'We have 2 new kittens and I had to find a better solution to standard litter boxes..', "I put the box together (a cinch), and the first cat had used it properly within the first ten minutes (I use Dr. Elsey's Cat Attract litter -- that s*** is magic, yo).", 'If you have sketchy cats like I do, I recommend using Precious cat attract litter with it, putting it next to the other litter box(s), and adding a little of the used litter into it to get the scent in the litter robot.', "He warmed up to it and was using it as his sole litter box after about 5 days, but I think you could scare off a more timid cat permanently if you don't follow the instructions.", 'So, if your cats are used to an open litter box or do not like small enclosed spaces, you will have a hard time getting them adjusted.', 'Even with both cats using this box I can quickly grab the bag out and put a new one in a matter of minutes once a week.', "Anytime a change happens and it involves the litter box, and this is something I've done with all my different cats over 7 years, is place them in the litter box to let them know it's there.  ", 'I bought the Litter Robot II and the CatGenie simultaneously (I have three cats and am always fostering two or three for a local rescue).  ', "I have two cats and i cut them from their old litter box to this one cold turkey and they took to it in a day (they had no choice, no where else to potty but my cats are older so they aren't lost confused kittens).", "After years of having to designate an entire room for our cats' litterbox (just two cats) because no one wanted to do anything in the same room, we finally invested in the Litter Robot.", "We did not do as recommended and leave the old box (my husband didn't want to clean it out and put fresh litter in it), and I think if we had, we might have had less trouble with the sixth cat.", 'And you know, if you have four cats and three litter boxes, the chances of the boxes all being clean at the same time is like...next to nothing.', "The only problem was with two cats I had to clean the litter box 5 times a day because they wouldn't use a dirty litter box.", 'In short, I would highly recommend the Litter Robot II or CatGenie, but I will be replacing my last old fashion litter box today and it will be with a Litter Robot II!  ', 'The Litter Robot is easy to change (about every five days for two cats), relatively quiet (much more so than the LitterMaid), cost efficient (both the bags and the litter are a considerable less investment than maintaining the LitterMaid which needed clumping litter without clay - in other words, the one LitterMaid sells), and for the first two weeks, fully entertaining to my cats.  ', "and I will have to take it outside and spray the top half of the unit with water, which takes a little more work than the regular litter box.- While it's good that the bottom bin doesn't leak any smell out at all because there's no holes on the steps, the cats do track a lot of litter when they come out", 'With the clumping litter, the bin fills up more quickly and with 3 cats, I have to change out bin twice a week, whereas the wheat litter is only once a week.', 'I have 2 cats, 10LB and 12LB, and I have to say, this unit cuts my litter box cleaning time by a lot!', 'It is nice that I don\'t have to scoop the litter box regularly anymore, but in my experience:-litter still gets caked to the bottom of the dome and you have to manually scrape it lose.-you have to change the bag in the discharge drawer every 2-3 days or it starts to smell.-there is no "seal" for the drawer, so order does escape.-litter still tracks outside of the box.-it indicates that you\'d only need to clean the dome with a hose approximately once a month, but we have to do it at least once a week otherwise our cats won\'t go in at anymore.  ', "I've had cats for 30 years, and simply could not handle buying yet another Littermaid Auto litter box.  ", 'So, if your cats like using the litter 10-15 minutes apart (like mine do), they always have clean litter.', "This thing is a litter box so there's still going to be litter on the floor outside because the little pellets get suck in the cats paws.  ", 'I have 2 cats, 10lbs & 17lbs, and they took some time to adjust but use the litter robot exclusively now.  ', 'A side bonus for those who have dogs (I have two small dogs so this may not apply to larger breeds) the design has promoted a disinterest in the litter box with the dogs.', "A few features are key: the "lip" on the entrance really works to keep everything in, even if your cat isn't committed to a full litter box entry, and the sealing tray with just regular old kitchen trash can liner cannot be mentioned too much.", 'I tried buying more litter boxes -', 'Moved into a new apartment with a cat that previously lived with my parents and a traditional litter box with multiple cats.', "It is almost certainly larger than whatever litter box you're using, and will require some space (both floor space and vertical space).", "Because as you clean one, two cats jump in that one while you're cleaning the other boxes.", 'My "purchase" story:Moved to a new place where I no longer had a "designated cat room" and the litter box would have to be in a common area.', 'But I kept hesitating, as past experience has been they worked great for the first few weeks, then it usually became a very expensive normal litter box.', 'If she has an issue with going in a litter box after one of the others, more boxes may not solve the issue, especially if they all decide to use the smae one at some point.  ', "and i wish there's some way they can put a divider between the poop catching bin and the step so they can still keep the holes to catch extra on the steps...I use Swheat Scoop multi-cat litter, results might vary depending on the type of litter used.", "I have to be quite money conscious, and this was nearly three times what I had ever spent on a litter box, but having gone through three LitterMaids (there are some serious design flaws both for function and durability with those), I had decided that it wouldn't hurt to at least try it based on the vastly glowing reviews I'd read.  ", 'If you have cats, if you hate changing litter, this is the solution for you!', '4 cats equal a lot of litter mess but litter robot is so easy to take care of, the cats all took to it right away, no smell and using kitchen plastic trash bags emptying out every 3 or 4 days right into trash can so easy.', 'I can admit, the thought of paying this kind of money for a litter box is troubling, however, after our LitterMaid box of 5  years is starting to fail, we thought we try something new.  ', 'Since I have additional litter boxes in the house, I simply removed the old litter box when I moved in the Litter Robot.', 'The downside is that you do have to buy and haul litter home, whereas the CatGenie has reusable granules, but due to the efficient and frequent filtering Litter Robot makes litter go alot further.  ', "I didn't give other litter box options as they suggest.", 'This one is taller, but has a smaller footprint than the old litter box, which i like too.  ', "With three cats, I think we'll need to empty the drawer (which, by the way, uses just basic garbage bags, like the 8 gallon, or 13 gallon type, the cheap ones you can buy at nearly any store) about 2 - 3 times a week.", 'We did not offer their old litterbox for the transition (it was thrown out immediately and was very satisfying to do so) and I would suggest others follow that route because it worked very well.', 'So just hold your nose (which luckily you will never again have to do in your own home!), apologize to your wallet, and buy it, especially if you have multiple cats.', 'Now, I put it close to the other litter box they mostly used.  ', 'I can go back to using a more natural litter than I could use with the other automatic litter boxes.  ', "I'm back to having only 2 cats because the foster cat got adopted, but I still clean out the bin about twice a week and water spray the rotating ball once a month.", "Since using this litter box with my 4 cats my house doesn't smell like a litter box anymore.", 'Now I have 1 regular litter box and the Litter Robot out.', 'I had 4 litter boxes, and have slowly taken each away.', "They've always been well behaved (and used to being moved around prior to my purchasing of my current home) about moved litter boxes as long as another was available and shown to them.", "I mean it's so nice having one litter box and no scooping that it is easy to forget that you need to change the bag.. passages.text: This cat litter box is great, I have had it for 2 and 1/2 months now.
We have 4 cats and one very large (tall and long) cat so finding a litter box to suit them all has been a challenge.
I even tried a different "traditional" litter box about six months ago that used pellets, and the cat would pee, it would go down through the pellets to a pad in a drawer.
The recommendation is 1 litter box per kitty then 1 more.
We have 2 new kittens and I had to find a better solution to standard litter boxes..
I put the box together (a cinch), and the first cat had used it properly within the first ten minutes (I use Dr. Elsey's Cat Attract litter -- that s*** is magic, yo).

If you have sketchy cats like I do, I recommend using Precious cat attract litter with it, putting it next to the other litter box(s), and adding a little of the used litter into it to get the scent in the litter robot.
He warmed up to it and was using it as his sole litter box after about 5 days, but I think you could scare off a more timid cat permanently if you don't follow the instructions.
So, if your cats are used to an open litter box or do not like small enclosed spaces, you will have a hard time getting them adjusted.
Even with both cats using this box I can quickly grab the bag out and put a new one in a matter of minutes once a week.
Anytime a change happens and it involves the litter box, and this is something I've done with all my different cats over 7 years, is place them in the litter box to let them know it's there.
I bought the Litter Robot II and the CatGenie simultaneously (I have three cats and am always fostering two or three for a local rescue).

I have two cats and i cut them from their old litter box to this one cold turkey and they took to it in a day (they had no choice, no where else to potty but my cats are older so they aren't lost confused kittens).
After years of having to designate an entire room for our cats' litterbox (just two cats) because no one wanted to do anything in the same room, we finally invested in the Litter Robot.
We did not do as recommended and leave the old box (my husband didn't want to clean it out and put fresh litter in it), and I think if we had, we might have had less trouble with the sixth cat.
And you know, if you have four cats and three litter boxes, the chances of the boxes all being clean at the same time is like...next to nothing.
The only problem was with two cats I had to clean the litter box 5 times a day because they wouldn't use a dirty litter box.
In short, I would highly recommend the Litter Robot II or CatGenie, but I will be replacing my last old fashion litter box today and it will be with a Litter Robot II!

The Litter Robot is easy to change (about every five days for two cats), relatively quiet (much more so than the LitterMaid), cost efficient (both the bags and the litter are a considerable less investment than maintaining the LitterMaid which needed clumping litter without clay - in other words, the one LitterMaid sells), and for the first two weeks, fully entertaining to my cats.

and I will have to take it outside and spray the top half of the unit with water, which takes a little more work than the regular litter box.- While it's good that the bottom bin doesn't leak any smell out at all because there's no holes on the steps, the cats do track a lot of litter when they come out
With the clumping litter, the bin fills up more quickly and with 3 cats, I have to change out bin twice a week, whereas the wheat litter is only once a week.
I have 2 cats, 10LB and 12LB, and I have to say, this unit cuts my litter box cleaning time by a lot!

It is nice that I don't have to scoop the litter box regularly anymore, but in my experience:-litter still gets caked to the bottom of the dome and you have to manually scrape it lose.-you have to change the bag in the discharge drawer every 2-3 days or it starts to smell.-there is no "seal" for the drawer, so order does escape.-litter still tracks outside of the box.-it indicates that you'd only need to clean the dome with a hose approximately once a month, but we have to do it at least once a week otherwise our cats won't go in at anymore.
I've had cats for 30 years, and simply could not handle buying yet another Littermaid Auto litter box.
So, if your cats like using the litter 10-15 minutes apart (like mine do), they always have clean litter.
This thing is a litter box so there's still going to be litter on the floor outside because the little pellets get suck in the cats paws.
I have 2 cats, 10lbs & 17lbs, and they took some time to adjust but use the litter robot exclusively now.
A side bonus for those who have dogs (I have two small dogs so this may not apply to larger breeds) the design has promoted a disinterest in the litter box with the dogs.

A few features are key: the "lip" on the entrance really works to keep everything in, even if your cat isn't committed to a full litter box entry, and the sealing tray with just regular old kitchen trash can liner cannot be mentioned too much.
I tried buying more litter boxes -
Moved into a new apartment with a cat that previously lived with my parents and a traditional litter box with multiple cats.
It is almost certainly larger than whatever litter box you're using, and will require some space (both floor space and vertical space).
Because as you clean one, two cats jump in that one while you're cleaning the other boxes.
My "purchase" story:Moved to a new place where I no longer had a "designated cat room" and the litter box would have to be in a common area.
But I kept hesitating, as past experience has been they worked great for the first few weeks, then it usually became a very expensive normal litter box.
If she has an issue with going in a litter box after one of the others, more boxes may not solve the issue, especially if they all decide to use the smae one at some point.
I would strongly recomend this catbox to anyone with more than one kitty.

and i wish there's some way they can put a divider between the poop catching bin and the step so they can still keep the holes to catch extra on the steps...I use Swheat Scoop multi-cat litter, results might vary depending on the type of litter used.

I have to be quite money conscious, and this was nearly three times what I had ever spent on a litter box, but having gone through three LitterMaids (there are some serious design flaws both for function and durability with those), I had decided that it wouldn't hurt to at least try it based on the vastly glowing reviews I'd read.
If you have cats, if you hate changing litter, this is the solution for you!

4 cats equal a lot of litter mess but litter robot is so easy to take care of, the cats all took to it right away, no smell and using kitchen plastic trash bags emptying out every 3 or 4 days right into trash can so easy.
I can admit, the thought of paying this kind of money for a litter box is troubling, however, after our LitterMaid box of 5  years is starting to fail, we thought we try something new.
Since I have additional litter boxes in the house, I simply removed the old litter box when I moved in the Litter Robot.
The downside is that you do have to buy and haul litter home, whereas the CatGenie has reusable granules, but due to the efficient and frequent filtering Litter Robot makes litter go alot further.
I didn't give other litter box options as they suggest.
This one is taller, but has a smaller footprint than the old litter box, which i like too.

With three cats, I think we'll need to empty the drawer (which, by the way, uses just basic garbage bags, like the 8 gallon, or 13 gallon type, the cheap ones you can buy at nearly any store) about 2 - 3 times a week.
We did not offer their old litterbox for the transition (it was thrown out immediately and was very satisfying to do so) and I would suggest others follow that route because it worked very well.
So just hold your nose (which luckily you will never again have to do in your own home!), apologize to your wallet, and buy it, especially if you have multiple cats.
Now, I put it close to the other litter box they mostly used.
This has worked well for a friend with multiple cats, so I ordered one.
I can go back to using a more natural litter than I could use with the other automatic litter boxes.
I'm back to having only 2 cats because the foster cat got adopted, but I still clean out the bin about twice a week and water spray the rotating ball once a month.
Since using this litter box with my 4 cats my house doesn't smell like a litter box anymore.
Now I have 1 regular litter box and the Litter Robot out.
I had 4 litter boxes, and have slowly taken each away.
They've always been well behaved (and used to being moved around prior to my purchasing of my current home) about moved litter boxes as long as another was available and shown to them.
I mean it's so nice having one litter box and no scooping that it is easy to forget that you need to change the bag..
I simply left my cats' dirty box near their litter robot (so they could choose to use the box that hadn't been changed in a few days or the clean new bot).
One full day of all four cats using this box exclusively (and this was while the other three boxes were still open), and I was sold.
Reiterating others' comments: reduced litter usage, cleaner, no smell, reduced cleaning times to twice a week  (3 cats) with kitchen garbage bags, quiet... just an all-around awesome product.

Due to attrition (DON'T LOOK AT ME THERE'S SOMETHING IN MY EYE THAT'S ALL) we're down to only two cats, and I change the bag in the in-house box once a week, and in the less used porch unit I only change the bag once every two weeks.
If you have the cash to spare, and you're too busy and/or just DETEST cleaning the litter box, you should definitely invest in one of these!!
I have four cats, only 2 use it currently.
We've had the litterbox for a week and it works so well.
I put it in the living room for the first five days, and then moved it to the kitchen, closing up old litter boxes as I went.
This is definitely the best litter box out there.

There is more room in the apartment (we don't have to sequester the stinky litter box) we have our closet space back, and the only problem is that the cats have made a game out of interrupting the cleaning cycle.
After a few days my cats mustered up the courage to use the robot instead of their old litter box.
In the past, I've tried traditional litter boxes, and LitterMaids.
My cats do not like to use the step to get in or out of the bot, so they do get a tiny bit of litter on the floor because they leap out of the litter robot when done.
It looks like it would be great but neither of my cats would go in it...and they are very good about helping with the reurn if it doesn't work for you but still BE AWARE...
Previous boxes I've owned either choked on the regular clumping litter or used blue litter crystals that were extremely expensive.

passages.text: I carry two full size pistols a 1911 and M&P 45 plus my S&W Sigma 9mm compact, shooting gloves, eye, ear protection, 1 extra magazine for each gun and about 500 or 600 rounds of ammo,half 45 half 9mm.

I have the plastic smith and wesson carrying case, cleaning gear(its in its own plastic case) ear pro (all verities), shooting gloves, pasties (black dots to cover up shot holes on targets), two cleaning mats (which came with this bag) eye pro (2x sets, with extra lenses).

Two pistols, one is a M& P shield, another medium size pistol, (btw if they were full size pistols they would still fit just fine) and one J frame revolver, plus earmuffs, ear plugs, few boxes of ammo, glasses, pack of 12" x 12" targets, four mags, mag loader, and still have room for more stuff.

There are plenty of pockets to fit 1000+ 22LR rounds, 2 pair of shooting glasses, pair of shooting gloves, screw driver, 100+ rounds of 380s, ruger handguns x 2, a monocular, bulky ear protector x 2, and still got more room...
I have plenty of room for my two pistols, ammo, eyes, ears, six inch Shoot n' C targets, tool pouches, speed loader and cleaning kit.
I received it and proceeded  to load it up with my supplies.500 rounds of ammo and two handguns fit nicely with room to spare  .I would recommend this range bag.
I own 5 handguns 2 full size 2 compact and 1 sub compact Sig P238
(Hearing Protection, Eye Protection, 300 Rounds, 2 Extra Magazines, and 2 Pistols!)

I don't carry cleaning kits, tools, targets, knifes etc, it's just not big enough for the extra stuff like shotgun ammo rifle ammo rifle magazines, I think this bag serves it's purpose for 3 handguns, protection and a few boxes ammo.

I would recommend this bag, the quality is very good, if you are going to the shooting range with multiple firearms and the usual items as listed above, a larger bag is what I use which I also purchased through Amazon.
The case is the perfect storage/carrier for my S&W M&P 9mm and accessories (ammunition, clips, cleaning materials, etc.
This little bag is capable of holding three handguns, ammo, ear muffs, and more.
My glock and S&W fit well.
and I'm able to fit@least 3 guns sometimes 4 if I include the compact and sub compact together, but for this review let's stick with 3 handguns.
It easily holds my M&P, Makarov , earmuffs, shooting glasses, several hundred rounds of ammo and room for more.

comments: I carry two full size pistols a 1911 and M&P 45 plus my S&W Sigma 9mm compact, shooting gloves, eye, ear protection, 1 extra magazine for each gun and about 500 or 600 rounds of ammo,half 45 half 9mm.

I have the plastic smith and wesson carrying case, cleaning gear(its in its own plastic case) ear pro (all verities), shooting gloves, pasties (black dots to cover up shot holes on targets), two cleaning mats (which came with this bag) eye pro (2x sets, with extra lenses).

Two pistols, one is a M& P shield, another medium size pistol, (btw if they were full size pistols they would still fit just fine) and one J frame revolver, plus earmuffs, ear plugs, few boxes of ammo, glasses, pack of 12" x 12" targets, four mags, mag loader, and still have room for more stuff.

There are plenty of pockets to fit 1000+ 22LR rounds, 2 pair of shooting glasses, pair of shooting gloves, screw driver, 100+ rounds of 380s, ruger handguns x 2, a monocular, bulky ear protector x 2, and still got more room...
I have plenty of room for my two pistols, ammo, eyes, ears, six inch Shoot n' C targets, tool pouches, speed loader and cleaning kit.
I received it and proceeded  to load it up with my supplies.500 rounds of ammo and two handguns fit nicely with room to spare  .I would recommend this range bag.
I own 5 handguns 2 full size 2 compact and 1 sub compact Sig P238
(Hearing Protection, Eye Protection, 300 Rounds, 2 Extra Magazines, and 2 Pistols!)

I don't carry cleaning kits, tools, targets, knifes etc, it's just not big enough for the extra stuff like shotgun ammo rifle ammo rifle magazines, I think this bag serves it's purpose for 3 handguns, protection and a few boxes ammo.

I would recommend this bag, the quality is very good, if you are going to the shooting range with multiple firearms and the usual items as listed above, a larger bag is what I use which I also purchased through Amazon.
The case is the perfect storage/carrier for my S&W M&P 9mm and accessories (ammunition, clips, cleaning materials, etc.
This little bag is capable of holding three handguns, ammo, ear muffs, and more.
and I'm able to fit@least 3 guns sometimes 4 if I include the compact and sub compact together, but for this review let's stick with 3 handguns.
It easily holds my M&P, Makarov , earmuffs, shooting glasses, several hundred rounds of ammo and room for more.

query: Help! I'm looking for a bag to hold my stuff-not for yoga, but for pilates and body sculpting. Need room for a 23" x 6" diameter mat, one resistance tube and 2 sets of hand weights - plus water bottle.  For some classes I carry a stability ball, so right now I have my hands so full, I can hardly open the door to the gym! Would appreciate any feedback.
answers:
While answering about finding a suitable bag for carrying various fitness equipment:  
+ 33 comments believe that the bag may not fit a 23" x 6" diameter mat along with other equipment.  
+ 19 comments think that while the bag is roomy for a yoga mat, it may not accommodate all the requested items.  
+ 10 comments suggest that the bag is suitable for thick rollable mats and possibly hand weights.  
+ 7 comments mention that the bag size may be smaller than advertised.
generation:
<s><s>[INST] You will be provided with a question and a JSON list of relevant review comments, delimited by triple quotes.
The question asks the opinions of user reviews about a product, and can be answered by the list of comment clusters in the provided JSON list. Each element in the JSON has been has been clustered to represent a common opinion answering the question, accompanied by the quantity.

You were tasked to generate a quantitative summary that covers all opinions captured in the JSON list in answering the questions.

Perform the following actions to solve this task:
- For every element in the JSON list, find the key point that represent the common opinion across the comments of the cluster
- Generate a long-form quantitative summary including all extracted key points and the cluster size, following the below template:
'While answering about [Question]:
+ [Cluster size] of comments believe that [Key Point 1]
+ [Cluster size] of comments believe that [Key Point 2]
...'

Below are fundamental rules:
+ Larger cluster means higher support for the key point and with a bigger cluster size, the quantity must be higher
+ Only use number to report the cluster size for each key point, avoiding vague terms (e.g., some, most)
+ Ensure that each key point extracted from a cluster is distinctive and doesn't redundantly cover aspects mentioned in larger clusters

 Question: """Help! I'm looking for a bag to hold my stuff-not for yoga, but for pilates and body sculpting. Need room for a 23" x 6" diameter mat, one resistance tube and 2 sets of hand weights - plus water bottle.  For some classes I carry a stability ball, so right now I have my hands so full, I can hardly open the door to the gym! Would appreciate any feedback."""
JSON List: """[{'comments': ["It's roomy enough to hold my thick mat along with workout clothes and a bottle of water.", 'I can fit my extra thick yoga mat, yoga towel, water bottle, and then I still have some extra room (maybe for flip flops, sunglasses, an umbrella?).', 'It is big enough to fit my mat, a towel, and a bottle of water.', "It's simply well made and big enough to hold my mat plus 2 mat towels, hand towel, cell phone, keys, etc.  ", 'This is the perfect bag for carrying a yoga mat, mat liner, and water bottle.  ', 'According to the description of this yoga mat, "Our large, durable and stylish Organic Cotton Yoga Monster Mat bag will hold even extra thick yoga mats and other tools such as towel, block, and water bottle".', '( avacado) Love the size, it fits my mat and my towel and water bottle with an extra side pocket for keys and phone and cash.', "I haven't really used this bag yet, but my mat (standard yoga-sized) fits in it just fine.  ", 'Bag easily stores my thick yoga mat, with some room left over.  ', "I don't have a typical yoga mat - it's a foam floor mat, about 1/4" thick,  52" long and 22 1/2" wide-when rolled up it's 6" in diameter.", 'The bag is the perfect size, fits my yoga mat, two blocks and my phone/keys.', 'I cannot fit anything but a standard sized Yoga mat, contrary to what others have said there is no room for a block, towel etc...', 'This bag is big enough for my mat, towel, water bottle and keys.  ', 'This bag is a little bit larger than most and it fits my thick 1 inch pilates mat.  ', 'The bag is as I had hoped, medium thickness durable canvas material, good zipper and strap and very roomy inside (see below for my thoughts on the stitching though).In general I cannot see how it is called "EXTRA LARGE" but compared to other yoga bags I could see calling it "large".  ', 'Because I have a Lulu mat, and am a heavy sweater I always have a yogi toes and towel I need room to carry these items; this bag is not the "extra large" they claim...', "It comfortably fits my Aurorae Synergy yoga mat, a towel (which I don't really even need anymore), and a water bottle with lots of room to spare.", "If you're looking for something to get your mat to and from class, this will do the trick but if you can spend a little more, treat yourself to something where you aren't having to work so hard to get your mat into your bag after class.", 'You have to really roll your mat and make it as small as you can to easily fit into this bag, otherwise you will have to work at getting your mat into the bag.', "I actually, at one point, had two yoga mats in there because I was giving my old one to a friend and didn't want to strap two to my back...makes for awkward walking.  ", 'Pros:breathable cottonLots of room inside if you have a dense mat (I use a 74" Jade Harmony mat) - not sure if you could get blocks in too but certainly room for a towel, yoga socks, cleaner, etc..Cons:The strap color is black and not the matching color in the photosThe zipper opening is a little tight making it a little hard to get the mat in', 'This bag was not big enough for my manduka yoga mat despite the "monster" claim.  ', "Make sure your mat fits: I have a long, medium-weight mat and although that's easy to move in and out, you can see that a slightly thicker mat might not fit.", 'I also like the pocket on the outside, where I can stash my wallet and keys during yoga class.', 'I only use this bag to carry my mat and two towels.', 'Pro: big enough for yoga mat and towel.', "This isn't the prettiest yoga bag but it does fit thick yoga mats.", 'I really appreciate a yoga mat bag that opens from the side.  ', 'It is only barely big enough to hold an extra-long mat.', 'If you roll it small enough, you can fit a full sized towel into the bag along with your mat, rolled together.', 'I find that after class, it takes some time rolling my mat and towel together and then working to fit it into the opening of the bag.', "This is a basic very large yoga bag, but it's exactly what I wanted.  ", "I've had this bag for a few months now and take it to yoga class a few times per week.", 'Large enough that I could bet a towel in as well as my mat.', "This yoga bag is perfect if you're looking for something roomy.", 'I had a hard time fiting my yoga towel in the bag with my mat.  ', 'I looked at a lot of yoga mat bags here before settling on this one', 'This is a very roomy yoga bag!', 'This yoga mat bag is great!', 'Perfect for transporting and protecting my $100+ Jade yoga mat.', 'To compound the complications, the strap is fairly tight against the bag to begin with but when you add a decent sized mat, it becomes taught against the zipper opening.  ', "I also wrap my yoga towel in there and it fits and maintains it's clynder shape.", 'well made, love the zipper pocket on the outside; however, this mat was shown in that strip of products that appears under the yoga'], 'cluster_size': 43}, {'comments': ['I could fit my mat and block, or 2 mats and maybe a water.', 'I actually roll 2 regular yoga mats into one and it fits.  ', "I'm guessing it would be perfect for anyone with a very thick mat, or two mats.  ", "This is the perfect size to carry two mats rolled together without being too bulky, so it's just what I needed."], 'cluster_size': 4}, {'comments': ['does accommodate mat and strap and cell phone in external pocket..  will have to carry the block in another bag, which I had hoped to avoid based on the claim of this product.  ', 'Bag is barely ok I was disappointed as many previous reviews stated how large it was - it is not large it just fits a standard mat .', 'Was as described, but my mat is wider than some and it was hard to fit into bag, works well with my old mat.', 'The largeness of the bag is really most appreciated in how easily the extra space allows a mat to be put in and taken out, the full side zipper helps with this also.', 'Adequate but I still have some difficulty getting a damp mat and towel into the bag.', 'While it is possible to fit the mat and towels into the bag, it is not easy.'], 'cluster_size': 6}]"""Summary: [/INST] While answering about the suitability of the bag for carrying a pilates and body sculpting mat, a resistance tube, hand weights, a water bottle, and sometimes a stability ball:

+ 43 of comments believe that the bag is big enough to hold a mat, towel, water bottle, and sometimes additional items such as keys, phone, or an umbrella.
+ 4 of comments believe that the bag can accommodate two mats rolled together or a thick mat and a block.
+ 6 of comments mention some difficulty fitting a damp mat and towel into the bag, or that the bag is only just big enough for a standard mat.</s>

passages.text: Straps cinched down properly so items were secure and wind noise was almost not there.

We encountered no real noise (other than increased wind noise of course) and what flapping of the straps there was we were able to eliminate after working on wrapping the straps around each other a bit.
I used a plastic bag or even a napkin to fill in the gap where the strap compresses the weather stripping right before I close the door and it is quite with no wind noise.
There was some road noise for small periods of time until I had a chance to pull off and re-secure the straps properly.
Due to the way the straps secure inside the car if you don't have a roof rack, it will compress the weather stripping to make some wind noise on the highway.
The only issue I had at first was the extra length of straps would whip around in the wind and make some noise.
Some vibration in the straps caused a "wing" effect creating vibration and noise.
I safety pinned straps down, so there was no noise.
Be sure to use the little clips to secure the loose ends of the straps or else they make an annoying flapping sound.

Secured extra flaps by tying them around straps and had almost no noise (one came out a little in the mountains, but no biggie).Also bought a lock for the zippers since we were staying overnight at hotels.
Make sure you get your straps secured or you will hear them flapping while driving.
I initially used the clips that are provided for this purpose, but the strap ends all worked their way out as we drove and made extremely loud flapping noises.
When I noticed a little humming from the straps as we drove at highter speeds, I was able to tug on the straps from inside and tighten it to eliminate the hum.

For my 1800 mile trip, I found the highway mpg were still better than my normal local around town driving (without the bag on top of the car).People have posted about the sherpak straps buzzing at highway speed indicating that the straps are too loose, but I found the real reason to be the way the airflow goes over the strap (not necessary for the rear straps).
But after the first pit stop I simply tied the ends of those long straps together and put them under the other cross straps and it never made any more noise.
The only thing bad I have to say about this, and it's not something avoidable anyway, the straps make noise when you're on the highway.

Despite the rear straps being a little loose, I had no shifting up to 80mph (didn't try faster than that).The bag is designed to be water proof, unfortunately, due to the unpredicatable wind forces thrown by creases in the bag as it is cinched down, water flow can be channeled up toward the zipper allowing some moisture to enter the pack.
I then used the straps through the door frame and there rest of the trip went smoothly.

comments: Straps cinched down properly so items were secure and wind noise was almost not there.

We encountered no real noise (other than increased wind noise of course) and what flapping of the straps there was we were able to eliminate after working on wrapping the straps around each other a bit.
I used a plastic bag or even a napkin to fill in the gap where the strap compresses the weather stripping right before I close the door and it is quite with no wind noise.
There was some road noise for small periods of time until I had a chance to pull off and re-secure the straps properly.
Due to the way the straps secure inside the car if you don't have a roof rack, it will compress the weather stripping to make some wind noise on the highway.
The only issue I had at first was the extra length of straps would whip around in the wind and make some noise.
Some vibration in the straps caused a "wing" effect creating vibration and noise.
I safety pinned straps down, so there was no noise.
Be sure to use the little clips to secure the loose ends of the straps or else they make an annoying flapping sound.

Secured extra flaps by tying them around straps and had almost no noise (one came out a little in the mountains, but no biggie).Also bought a lock for the zippers since we were staying overnight at hotels.
Make sure you get your straps secured or you will hear them flapping while driving.
I initially used the clips that are provided for this purpose, but the strap ends all worked their way out as we drove and made extremely loud flapping noises.
When I noticed a little humming from the straps as we drove at highter speeds, I was able to tug on the straps from inside and tighten it to eliminate the hum.

For my 1800 mile trip, I found the highway mpg were still better than my normal local around town driving (without the bag on top of the car).People have posted about the sherpak straps buzzing at highway speed indicating that the straps are too loose, but I found the real reason to be the way the airflow goes over the strap (not necessary for the rear straps).
But after the first pit stop I simply tied the ends of those long straps together and put them under the other cross straps and it never made any more noise.
The only thing bad I have to say about this, and it's not something avoidable anyway, the straps make noise when you're on the highway.

Despite the rear straps being a little loose, I had no shifting up to 80mph (didn't try faster than that).The bag is designed to be water proof, unfortunately, due to the unpredicatable wind forces thrown by creases in the bag as it is cinched down, water flow can be channeled up toward the zipper allowing some moisture to enter the pack.

passages.text: I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a good military/fighting knife, and having seen the leather-handle USMC version at a fair this last summer for $80 I couldn't be happier with Amazon's price; especially if you've ever gone to Ka-Bar's website and seen their prices.

The knife came just as described with the leather sheath and the original Ka Bar box.

one of the best survival knives out there many have come and gone but there is still Ka-Bar.

but I guess you could expect that since its kraton, not a big problem, the knife is not lose at all its extremely solid, don't have any regrets if you want a ka-bar do your self a favor buy it.

if you are considering buying this knife, you likely know the ka-bar history, if not - read up on it, it's pretty interesting stuff.

I can now start the water and know that it will slow to a trickle once hot, while I do something else.

passages.text: Started removal: Used a plastic scrapper to remove 'goo', I couldn't beleve it, there was the original wood surface.
I saw a few folks mention cleaning with water but I wouldn't recommend that as it raises the grain of the wood.
It seemed now matter how much degreaser and/or water I applied afterward, the wood still felt like it had an oily residue on it.

I removed the finish from my coffeetable in about 2 minutes after waiting for Soygel to eat through the finish (about 1 hour)This is an amazing product, it doesn't smell or burn - when you scrape off the old finish, it isn't sticky like a chemical stripper more like a loose jelly.
3-4 hours after application seemed to be the magic number before I took a stripping tool to the wood.
Use a shop towel to wipe the residue off the wood.

The only other product I used that removed the paint as well as the Soy Gel was a lye-based product (ventilator, eye shield, the whole hazmat get-up) that looked good at first, but unfortunately dried out the wood to an unattractive gray.
The product does work, and it did remove about 90% of 4 layers of paint with some aggressive pressure-washing (after letting the stripper work for about three hours).

Soygel after 6 hours removed 40% of the paint perfectly and the other paint not at all, but what it left me is a softened paint that will not come up and has left a coating on my floor like sticky gum.

comments: Started removal: Used a plastic scrapper to remove 'goo', I couldn't beleve it, there was the original wood surface.
I saw a few folks mention cleaning with water but I wouldn't recommend that as it raises the grain of the wood.
It seemed now matter how much degreaser and/or water I applied afterward, the wood still felt like it had an oily residue on it.

I removed the finish from my coffeetable in about 2 minutes after waiting for Soygel to eat through the finish (about 1 hour)This is an amazing product, it doesn't smell or burn - when you scrape off the old finish, it isn't sticky like a chemical stripper more like a loose jelly.
3-4 hours after application seemed to be the magic number before I took a stripping tool to the wood.
Use a shop towel to wipe the residue off the wood.

The only other product I used that removed the paint as well as the Soy Gel was a lye-based product (ventilator, eye shield, the whole hazmat get-up) that looked good at first, but unfortunately dried out the wood to an unattractive gray.
The product does work, and it did remove about 90% of 4 layers of paint with some aggressive pressure-washing (after letting the stripper work for about three hours).

Soygel after 6 hours removed 40% of the paint perfectly and the other paint not at all, but what it left me is a softened paint that will not come up and has left a coating on my floor like sticky gum.

passages.text: (again, these are top-of-the line lithiums I'm testing, as regular store alkalines discharge so quickly in professional audio gear that they're not even worth trying)Yes the tester seems expensive, but it works flawlessly, is solidly-built, accurately tests the remaining strength, and you'll quickly get a return on your investment & end up saving money by using old-but good batteries instead of prematurely buying new fresh batteries.
The photo is of the latest version of the MBT-1 that tests AA Lithium (L91) batteries.
I use that spot to test my AAA lithiums, but I'm not sure the percentage of charge remaining is accurate.
The only one I have encountered which is not listed on the tester is a AA rechargeable, Nickel-Cadmium, 1.2V battery.
The charger with it's discharge/recharge cycling helped me find more "AA"s that would come up to voltage so looked good on the tester, but when used would quickly drop flat.
You choose the type of battery you want to test - lithium or ni-cad, alkaline in a large number of various types - AA, AAA, C, D, CR123, etc.

A test seems to take only 3-4 seconds for a AA battery.
This tool does, and so its readings are much more accurate, provided you read the instructions and test the batteries 2-3 times.
I tried so many other testers, this one works perfectly with most AA and AAA batteries and many other types and sizes, remember to buy the pouch for storage.

Skip the other cheap testers...they test voltage only...the MBT-1 actually tests load...giving your batteries a little workout to find out how much strength they can continue to provide in the future.
I would recommend to anyone, it tests the battery under load, so you know the reading is accurate.
Easy to use and unlike most battery testers that only measure voltage, this tester actually put a load on the battery.

Now that I found this tester I am happy, because it tests a battery the way a battery should be tested.
It is, however, rather big and cumbersome, so i will continue to use the Mini-MBT to test the AA and AAA size batteries that I have.

There are no Wii controls to the game; no shaking or pointing the Wii remote or anything.
You can play this game with either the Wii classic controller, a gamecube controller or the Wii remote by turning it sideways and using it as a pad (like on Super Paper Mario).PS:
It offers a variety of ways to do the game play, and I choose using the Wiimote and nunchuk in the "traditional" Wii fashion.
I remember it being fun on the Gamecube, but using the wii remote for shooting (which you must get used to, I'll admit) makes the experience all the more fun.
